channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023121051
item.description:
Report X-2023121051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED IN A TRAILER IN UNLOAD C BY AN UNLOADER. THE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. THE CONTAINER APPEARED TO BE WET AND A SMALL PUNCTURE HOLE WAS DISCOVED NEAR THE BOTTOM. USING THE DECISION TREE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. THE CONTAINER WAS A PLASTIC 5 GALLON JUG AND DID NOT HAVE ANY OUTER PACKAGING.

item.title: Report X-2023121045
item.description:
Report X-2023121045

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON THE FLOOR OF THE PD-9 OUTBOUND DOCK OF THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND UPRIGHT WITH A DAMP CORNER ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. THE SPILL WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTACLES (1 GALLON CLOSED HEAD METAL BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023121063
item.description:
Report X-2023121063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WET PACKAGE WAS REPORTED ON THE RED PDC FLOOR. BOX WAS WET BUT NOT ACTIVELY LEAKING. BOX WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AND UPON INSPECTION FOUND INNER BOX THAT HAD A CORROSIVE 8 DIAMOND HAZMAT LABEL AND UN PRODUCT AND BOX INFORMATION. PROCESSED UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report E-2023120387
item.description:
Report E-2023120387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: HAYTI
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced an over the road release of NA1993 Spec-Aid* 8Q123ULS from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 1â€™ x 5â€™ area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.
